titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Queens County Treasurer's Office land auction bills of sale 1977.569
titlestmt.author: Nicholas Pavlik
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was originally processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-12-07 21:49:56 +0000.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

did.unittitle: Queens County Treasurer's Office land auction bills of sale
did.abstract: Bills of sale for plots of land in the town of Jamaica, Queens County sold by the Queens County Treasurer's Office at public auction in 1875.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Gift of George and Marjorie North Finkeldey, 1968.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This small collection is housed in a single folder.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Queens County Treasurer's Office land auction bills of sale, 1977.569, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Public Library, Center for Brooklyn History.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Minimally processed to the collection level. This collection was rehoused and the finding aid revised by Dee Bowers in 2023.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Bills of sale for plots of land in the town of Jamaica, Queens County sold by the Queens County Treasurer's Office at public auction. The land had formerly belonged to Silas Butler but was seized due to Butler's failure to pay taxes. The bills are signed by George Bergen, Treasurer of Queens County, and dated 1875.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The materials in this collection are in the public domain. While many items at the Center for Brooklyn History are unrestricted, we do not own reproduction rights to all materials. Be aware of the several kinds of rights that might apply: copyright, licensing and trademarks. The researcher assumes all responsibility for copyright questions.
